description: Probably a blend of irrespective +‎ regardless; the word can also be analysed as ir- +‎ regardless because it is possible that the prefix ir- was added to amplify the negative in regardless just as plain negatives often did at the time the word came into use (and still do in dialects).

entries.meaning: (nonstandard, proscribed, sometimes humorous) Irrespective, regardless. [from mid 19th c.]
